SEARCH
Package io.brane.contract

Class BraneContract

java.lang.Object
io.brane.contract.BraneContract
public final class BraneContract extends Object
Dynamic proxy-based contract binding system that maps Java interfaces to smart contracts.

This class enables type-safe smart contract interaction by binding a Java interface to a contract's ABI. At runtime, it creates a dynamic proxy that:

  • Encodes method calls to contract function calls (ABI encoding)
  • Routes view/pure functions to eth_call (read-only)
  • Routes state-changing functions to sendTransactionAndWait (write)
  • Decodes return values from hex to Java types (ABI decoding)

Supported Type Mappings:

  • uint8, uint256, int256 → BigInteger
  • address → Address
  • bool → boolean/Boolean
  • string → String
  • bytes, bytes32 → byte[]/HexData
  • T[] → T[]/List<T>

Limitations:

  • Tuple/Struct return types: Functions returning Solidity structs or tuples are not currently supported. The proxy binding will fail at bind time with "Unsupported return type" for methods that return Java record types or custom classes.

Method Return Types:

  • View/Pure functions: Contract output type (e.g., BigInteger)
  • State-changing functions: TransactionReceipt, void, or Void

Complete Usage Example: 


 // 1. Define Java interface matching contract ABI
 public interface Erc20Contract {
     // View function: balanceOf(address) returns (uint256)
     BigInteger balanceOf(Address owner);

     // State-changing: transfer(address,uint256) returns (bool)
     TransactionReceipt transfer(Address to, BigInteger amount);

     // Can also return void for state-changing functions
     void approve(Address spender, BigInteger amount);
 }

 // 2. Load contract ABI JSON
 String abiJson = Files.readString(Path.of("erc20-abi.json"));

 // 3. Connect to network with signing capability
 Brane.Signer client = Brane.connect("https://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/...", signer);

 // 4. Bind interface to deployed contract
 Erc20Contract usdc = BraneContract.bind(
         Address.from("0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48"), // USDC address
         abiJson,
         client,
         Erc20Contract.class);

 // 5. Call view functions (no gas, instant)
 BigInteger balance = usdc.balanceOf(myAddress);
 System.out.println("Balance: " + balance);

 // 6. Call state-changing functions (costs gas, returns receipt)
 TransactionReceipt receipt = usdc.transfer(
         recipientAddress,
         new BigInteger("1000000") // 1 USDC (6 decimals)
 );

 if (receipt.status()) {
     System.out.println("Transfer confirmed in block " + receipt.blockNumber());
 }

Validation: The bind(io.brane.core.types.Address, java.lang.String, io.brane.rpc.Brane.Signer, java.lang.Class<T>) method validates that:

  • All interface methods exist in the ABI
  • Parameter counts and types match
  • Return types are compatible with function mutability (view vs non-view)

Implementation: Uses Java's Proxy API with invocation handlers to intercept method calls and translate them to RPC calls.

Runtime Exceptions from Proxy Methods: Methods on the bound contract proxy may throw these exceptions at runtime:

  • View/Pure functions:
    • RpcException - RPC communication failures
    • RevertException - Contract reverted (includes revert reason if available)
    • AbiDecodingException - Failed to decode return value
  • State-changing functions:
    • RpcException - RPC communication failures or transaction rejection
    • AbiEncodingException - Failed to encode function parameters
See Also:
  • Abi
  • Brane
  • Brane.Signer

  • Method Details

    • bindReadOnly

      public static <T> T bindReadOnly(Address address, String abiJson, Brane client, Class<T> contractInterface)
      Binds a Java interface to a deployed smart contract for read-only operations.

      Creates a type-safe proxy instance that implements the specified interface. This method only supports view/pure functions - attempting to call state-changing functions will throw UnsupportedOperationException.

      Interface Requirements:

      • Must be an interface (not a class)
      • Method names must exactly match ABI function names
      • All methods must be view or pure functions
      • Parameter types must match Solidity types
      • Return types must be compatible with function mutability

      Example: 

      
 // Define read-only interface
 public interface Erc20View {
     BigInteger balanceOf(Address owner);
     String name();
     String symbol();
     BigInteger decimals();
 }

 // Bind using Brane
 Brane client = Brane.connect("https://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/...");
 Erc20View token = BraneContract.bindReadOnly(
         Address.from("0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48"),
         abiJson,
         client,
         Erc20View.class);

 BigInteger balance = token.balanceOf(myAddress);
      Type Parameters:
      T - the contract interface type
      Parameters:
      address - the deployed contract address
      abiJson - the contract ABI in JSON format
      client - the Brane client for read operations
      contractInterface - the Java interface class representing the contract
      Returns:
      a proxy instance implementing the contract interface (read-only)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails or interface contains non-view functions
      NullPointerException - if any parameter is null
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • bind

      public static <T> T bind(Address address, String abiJson, Brane.Signer client, Class<T> contractInterface)
      Binds a Java interface to a deployed smart contract for read-write operations using the new Brane.Signer API.

      Creates a type-safe proxy instance that implements the specified interface. Method calls on the proxy are translated to contract function calls:

      • View/pure functions → eth_call via Brane.Signer
      • State-changing functions → sendTransactionAndWait via Brane.Signer

      Interface Requirements:

      • Must be an interface (not a class)
      • Method names must exactly match ABI function names
      • Parameter types must match Solidity types
      • Return types must be compatible with function mutability

      Example: 

      
 // Define contract interface
 public interface Erc20Contract {
     BigInteger balanceOf(Address owner);
     TransactionReceipt transfer(Address to, BigInteger amount);
 }

 // Bind using Brane.Signer
 Brane.Signer client = Brane.connect("https://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/...", signer);
 Erc20Contract token = BraneContract.bind(
         Address.from("0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48"),
         abiJson,
         client,
         Erc20Contract.class);

 BigInteger balance = token.balanceOf(myAddress);
 TransactionReceipt receipt = token.transfer(recipient, amount);
      Type Parameters:
      T - the contract interface type
      Parameters:
      address - the deployed contract address
      abiJson - the contract ABI in JSON format
      client - the Brane.Signer client for read and write operations
      contractInterface - the Java interface class representing the contract
      Returns:
      a proxy instance implementing the contract interface
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails (method not in ABI, type mismatch, etc.)
      NullPointerException - if any parameter is null
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • bind

      public static <T> T bind(Address address, String abiJson, Brane.Signer client, Class<T> contractInterface, ContractOptions options)
      Binds a Java interface to a deployed smart contract for read-write operations using the new Brane.Signer API with custom options.

      Creates a type-safe proxy instance that implements the specified interface. Method calls on the proxy are translated to contract function calls:

      • View/pure functions → eth_call via Brane.Signer
      • State-changing functions → sendTransactionAndWait via Brane.Signer

      Example with custom options: 

      
 var options = ContractOptions.builder()
     .gasLimit(500_000L)
     .timeout(Duration.ofSeconds(30))
     .pollInterval(Duration.ofMillis(100))
     .build();

 Erc20Contract usdc = BraneContract.bind(
         address, abiJson, client, Erc20Contract.class, options);
      Type Parameters:
      T - the contract interface type
      Parameters:
      address - the deployed contract address
      abiJson - the contract ABI in JSON format
      client - the Brane.Signer client for read and write operations
      contractInterface - the Java interface class representing the contract
      options - the contract options for gas limit, timeouts, etc.
      Returns:
      a proxy instance implementing the contract interface
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails (method not in ABI, type mismatch, etc.)
      NullPointerException - if any parameter is null
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • deployRequest

      public static TransactionRequest deployRequest(String abiJson, String bytecode, Object... args)
      Creates a deployment transaction request for a contract.
      Parameters:
      abiJson - the contract ABI JSON
      bytecode - the contract bytecode (hex string)
      args - constructor arguments
      Returns:
      a TransactionRequest ready to be sent
